componentDescription.fullDesc: Reads data from flat files.

metaField.fieldDesc: wrong value - the value that cannot be set into field
error message - detail information about this error

example.exampleXml:
<Node id="InputFile" type="DATA_READER" fileURL="data.txt">
<Node id="InputFile" type="DATA_READER" fileURL="zip:http://www.store.com/data.zip#data.txt" charset="ISO-8859-15" dataPolicy="Controlled" skipLeadingBlanks="false" trim="false" skipFirstLine="true" skipRows="1" numRecords="100" maxErrorCount="0" quotedStrings="false" treatMultipleDelimitersAsOne="false" />
example.exampleDesc: This a sentence in example description. This a sentence in example description. This a sentence in example description. This a sentence in example description. This a sentence in example description. This a sentence in example description. This a sentence in example description. This a sentence in example description. This a sentence in example description. componentDescription.briefDesc: Reads data formated with delimiters from a file
componentDescription.fullDesc: Parses specified input data file and broadcasts the records to all connected out ports.

componentDescription.briefDesc: Writes data to a file formated using delimiters
componentDescription.fullDesc: All records from input port [0] are formatted with delimiter and written to specified file. Delimiters are taken from metadata specified for port[0] data flow.

componentDescription.briefDesc: Copies data from sourceport to the outputs.
componentDescription.fullDesc: All records from input port:0 are copied onto all connected output ports.

All records from all input ports are copied onto output port [0]. It goes port by port (waiting/blocked) if there is currently no data on port. When reading from one port is done (EOF status), continues with the next.
All records from all input ports are gathered and copied onto output port [0]. It goes port by port (waiting/blocked) if there is currently no data on port. Implements inverse RoundRobin.

Changes / reformats data record between one INPUT and several OUTPUT ports. This component is only a wrapper around transformation class implementing org.jetel.component.RecordTransform interface. The method transform is called for every record passing through this component.

This component reads data from DB. It first executes specified query on DB and then extracts all the rows returned. The metadata provided throuh output port/edge must precisely describe the structure of read rows. Use DBAnalyze utilitity to analyze DB structures and create Jetel/Clover metadata.

componentDescription.briefDesc: Sorts incoming records based on a key
componentDescription.fullDesc: Sorts the incoming records based on specified key. The key is name (or combination of names) of field(s) from input record. The sort order is either Ascending (default) or Descending.
This component performs append (so far) operation on specified database table. The metadata describing data comming in through input port[0] must be in the same structure as the target table.
All records from input port [0] are formatted with sizes specified in metadata and written to specified file. Sizes are taken from metadata specified for port[0] data flow.

Dedup (remove duplicate records) from sorted incoming records based on specified key. The key is name (or combination of names) of field(s) from input record. It keeps either First or Last record from the group based on the parameter {keep} specified. All duplicated records are rejected to the second optional port.
Parses specified fixed-length-record, input data file and broadcasts the records to all connected out ports.

Merges data records from two input ports onto one output. It preserves sorted order (as specified by the merge key) The structure of records in all merged data flows must be the same - it implies that all input ports share the same metadata.

Joins sorted records on input ports. It expects that on port [0], there is a driver and on port [1] is slave For each driver record, all slave records with corresponding key are found and sent to transformation class.

Joins sorted records on input ports. It expects that on port [0], there is a driver and on port [1] is slave For each driver record, all slave records with corresponding key are found and sent to transformation class.

componentDescription.briefDesc: Discards all the input. Used for debugging graphs.
componentDescription.fullDesc: All records from input port:0 are discarded.
All records for which the filterExpression evaluates TRUE are copied from input port:0 onto output port:0. Rejected records are copied onto output port:1 (if it is connected).
This component executes specified command(s) (SQL/DML) against specified DB

Joins records on input ports. It expects that on port [0], there is a driver and on port [1] is a slave For each driver record, slave record is looked up in Hashtable which is created from all records on slave port. Pair of driver and slave records is sent to transformation class.

Joins records on input ports. It expects that on port [0], there is a driver and on port [1] is a slave For each driver record, slave record is looked up in Hashtable which is created from all records on slave port. Pair of driver and slave records is sent to transformation class.

Checks a foreign key against a table of primary keys to see if the foreign key is valid. If the foreign key is invalid then a default foreign key is substituted. The resulting foreign record is broadcast to all connected outputs. The table containing the "primary" keys may contain duplicates but they will be ignored.
Reads records from specified dBase data file and broadcasts the records to all connected out ports.
All records for which the filterExpression evaluates TRUE are copied from input port:0 onto output port:0. Rejected records are copied onto output port:1 (if it is connected).

Sorts the incoming records based on specified key. The key is name (or combination of names) of field(s) from input record. The sort order is either Ascending (default) or Descending. In case there is not enough room in internal sort buffer, it performs external sorting - thus any number of internal records can be sorted.
Partitions data into distinct flows. Each connected port becomes one flow. For each record read, the partition function chosen denotes which output flow (port) will be the record sent to.

Finds intersection of data flows (sets) A (in-port0) and B (in-port1) based on specified key. Both inputs must be sorted according to specified key. DataRecords only in flow A are sent out through out-port[0]. DataRecords in both A&B are sent to specified transformation function and the result is sent through out-port[1]. DataRecords present only in flow B are sent through out-port[2].
Aggregate functions are applied on input data flow base on specified key. The key is name (or combination of names) of field(s) from input record. Data flow can be sorted or not.
Provides the logic to parse a xml file and filter to different ports based on a matching element. The element and all children will be turned into a Data record.
Executes system command.
Creates key from given fields
Joins data from two input ports which are similar on given fields
Joins records from input port with records from database
Reads data from xls files.

componentDescription.briefDesc: Loads data into an mssql database.
componentDescription.fullDesc: This component loads data to an MsSql database using the bcp utility. It creates a temporary file with bcp commands depending on input parameters. Data are read from given input file or from input port and loaded to database. Any generated temporary files can be optionally logged to help diagnose problems. To use this component MsSql client must be installed and configured on the local host. Note: when data is read from input port, one of these values (nativeType, characterType, wideCharacterType, keepNonTextNative, formatFile) in parameters attribute has to be used.

componentDescription.briefDesc: Loads data into an mysql database.
componentDescription.fullDesc: This component loads data to mysql database using the mysql utility. There is created mysql command (LOAD DATA INFILE) depending on input parameters. Data are read from given input file or from the input port and loaded to database. Any generated scripts/commands can be optionally logged to help diagnose problems. Before you use this component, make sure that mysql client is installed and configured on the machine where CloverETL runs and mysql command line tool available.
Joins records from input port with records from lookup table
Provides the logic to parse a xml file and filter to different ports based on a matching element by xpath. The element and all direct children will be turned into a Data record.

componentDescription.author: jvicenik
componentDescription.briefDesc: Runs specified graph(s) optionally in another instance of clover.
componentDescription.fullDesc: Runs specified graph(s) optionally in another instance of clover. If graphName is specified, the component is in pipeline mode. That means it only executes the specified graph if some data comes through the input edge or the input is not connected. If the execution of the graph is successful, an information record is sent to the first output port, otherwise to the second one. Any of these port may not be connected as well. If graphName isn't specified, graph names are read from the input edge (in this case the first field of input metadata must be string) and status messages are sent to the first output port.

port.portDesc: in pipeline mode: a record which triggers execution of the graph. Otherwise names of the graphs to be executed

metadataField.fieldDesc: In a case of error: ID of the component where the problem occured
In a case of error: ID of the component where the problem occured

port.portDesc: regular mode: status messages, pipeline mode: an information record in case of successful termination, otherwise nothing

metadataField.fieldDesc: In a case of error: The error message
In a case of error: ID of the component where the problem occured

port.portDesc: in pipeline mode an information record in case of an error, otherwise nothing

metadataField.fieldDesc: In a case of error: The error message
In a case of error: ID of the component where the problem occured

attribute.attrDesc: name of the graph to be executed; if this parameter is specified, the pipeline mode is activated
if false, run the graph in separate instance of clover, otherwise run it in the same instance
Name of the file into which all the standard output of the executed graphs is redirected. It is only used when the graph is run in another instance of clover.
Whether to append the output into the log file logFile
Aternative Java virtual machine with command line arguments
Command line arguments for clover; if sameInstance is false, at least the -plugins argument must be specified here
